intro: Helicteres pintonis, commonly known as the Mexican candlewood, is a shrub native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Helicteres pintonis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some indigenous communities.
